intro: Hedlundia hazslinszkyana, commonly known as the Hungarian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Hedlundia hazslinszkyana is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
